summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a FOIA request from a media company for audio, video, photographic, and other records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The SDNY indicates the requested materials are evidence in an ongoing investigation and pending criminal case against Maxwell and are not public.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the FOIA request and the pending criminal case USA v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The email states materials about her are evidence in an ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the FOIA request alongside Ghislaine Maxwell. The request seeks records related to him, his properties, and associates.

persons.name: Kevina Tidwell
persons.context: Named in the email subject line as the point of contact for the media company making the FOIA request for records related to Epstein and Maxwell.

connections.description: The FOIA request groups them together as subjects for requested investigative materials (audio, video, photos, witness interviews).

events.title: FOIA Request Acknowledgment
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney for the SDNY responds to a FOIA request, stating that any materials in the requested categories are evidence in the ongoing investigation and pending criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Internal Email Clarification
events.description: An email clarifies that the FOIA request is not being handled by the sender's office and suggests using a (b)(7)(A) exemption if disclosure would harm an ongoing investigation.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) confirms it possesses materials related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell but classifies them as evidence in an ongoing investigation and pending criminal case (USA v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).
A media company, via Kevina Tidwell, submitted a broad FOIA request for audio, video, photographic, and transcript records related to Epstein, Maxwell, victims, witnesses, and their properties.
The SDNY's position is that the requested materials are not public due to the active status of the investigation and prosecution against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email chain shows internal DOJ coordination regarding the handling of sensitive FOIA requests related to high-profile criminal cases.
